quotes.quote: Ugrashravas, the son of Lomaharshana, humbly approaches the sages in Naimisha forest, bowing with folded hands.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A broad-shouldered man with dark wavy hair and earnest eyes, wearing simple saffron robes, bows deeply before a circle of seated figures. The forest clearing glows with golden afternoon light filtering through ancient banyan trees, their roots twisting into the earth.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: character introduction. Based on lines 0-40 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: लोमहर्षणपुत्र उग्रश्रवाः...विनयावनतो भूत्वा

quotes.quote: The ascetics of Naimisha forest gather eagerly around Ugrashravas, their faces alight with anticipation for sacred tales.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: Elderly figures with silver beards and sun-weathered skin in ochre drapes lean forward attentively. Their hands rest on wooden staffs as dappled sunlight plays across their expressive faces. Butterflies flutter near wildflowers at the clearing's edge.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: audience anticipation. Based on lines 0-40 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: चित्राः श्रोतुं कथास्तत्र परिवव्रुस्तपस्विनः

quotes.quote: A venerable sage with eyes like lotus petals questions Ugrashravas about his journey and the stories he carries.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A particularly aged figure with a long white beard and piercing almond-shaped eyes gestures gracefully. His wrinkled hands move like river currents as he speaks. The storyteller sits cross-legged on a woven mat, sunlight catching the dust motes between them.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: dialogue initiation. Based on lines 0-40 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: अथापृच्छदृषिस्तत्र कश्चित्प्रस्तावयन्कथाः

quotes.quote: Ugrashravas begins recounting the sacred tales heard at Janamejaya's serpent sacrifice, his hands animated with devotion.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The storyteller's face glows with reverence as he raises both hands, fingers tracing shapes in the air. The sages' eyes widen slightly, their postures still as ancient trees. A gentle breeze carries pink petals across the scene, blending with the golden light.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: storytelling commencement. Based on lines 0-40 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: सूत उवाच...कृष्णद्वैपायनप्रोक्ताः

quotes.quote: The aged storyteller with a long white beard begins recounting the Mahabharata's origins, his hands moving gracefully as dust motes dance in golden sunlight.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A particularly aged figure with a long white beard and piercing almond-shaped eyes gestures gracefully. His wrinkled hands move like river currents as he speaks. The storyteller sits cross-legged on a woven mat, sunlight catching the dust motes between them.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: storytelling initiation. Based on lines 40-80 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: श्रुत्वाहं ता विचित्रार्था महाभारतसंश्रिताः

quotes.quote: The listeners, men with weathered faces and earth-toned garments, lean forward intently as petals float on the breeze around them.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: Three figures with long grey beards and deep-set eyes sit in rapt attention, their ochre robes pooling around them. Pink petals drift through shafts of golden light between them and the storyteller.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: audience engagement. Based on lines 40-80 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: बहूनि सम्परिक्रम्य तीर्थान्यायतनानि च

quotes.quote: The storyteller's face glows as he describes the sacred battlefield of Kurukshetra, his fingers tracing the air as if drawing the scene.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The white-bearded figure raises both hands, fingers shaping invisible forms. His face shines with reverence, casting soft shadows across his deeply lined features. A warm breeze stirs the edges of his saffron robe.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: sacred place revelation. Based on lines 40-80 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: समन्तपञ्चकं नाम पुण्यं द्विजनिषेवितम्

quotes.quote: One listener with particularly bright eyes clasps his hands together, his expression alight with understanding as the story's deeper meanings unfold.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A thin man with silver-streaked black hair presses his palms together, his dark eyes wide with realization. Sunlight catches the tears welling in his eyes as he sits among drifting petals and golden dust.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: epiphany moment. Based on lines 40-80 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: वेदार्थैर्भूषितस्य च

quotes.quote: Ugrashravas, the son of Lomaharshana, humbly approaches the sages in Naimisha forest, where they gather for a twelve-year sacrifice.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: A slender man with dark, tied-back hair and a gentle expression, wearing simple ochre robes, walks towards a circle of white-bearded men in earth-toned garments. Golden sunlight filters through ancient trees, casting dappled shadows on the forest floor.
quotes.context: Frame 1 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: character introduction. Based on lines 0-40 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: लोमहर्षणपुत्र उग्रश्रवाः सूतः पौराणिको नैमिषारण्ये शौनकस्य कुलपतेर्द्वादशवार्षिके सत्रे

quotes.quote: With folded hands, Ugrashravas respectfully greets the ascetics who eagerly gather to hear sacred stories from the Mahabharata.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The dark-haired man bows deeply, hands pressed together, before seated figures with serene faces and long white beards. Their ashram surroundings feature simple wooden seats and a sacred fire pit glowing softly in the afternoon light.
quotes.context: Frame 2 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: respectful greeting. Based on lines 0-40 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: विनयावनतो भूत्वा कदाचित्सूतनन्दनः तमाश्रममनुप्राप्तं नैमिषारण्यवासिनः

quotes.quote: The sages welcome Ugrashravas and inquire about his journey, their faces alight with curiosity about the stories he carries.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: An elder with a flowing silver beard leans forward, his weathered hands gesturing warmly as he speaks to the visitor. Other ascetics with kind eyes and draped in saffron sit attentively in the forest clearing, surrounded by blooming lotuses.
quotes.context: Frame 3 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: inquisitive dialogue. Based on lines 0-40 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: अथापृच्छदृषिस्तत्र कश्चित्प्रस्तावयन्कथाः कुत आगम्यते सौते क्व चायं विहृतस्त्वया

quotes.quote: Ugrashravas begins his tale of Janamejaya's serpent sacrifice, where the Mahabharata was first recited by Vaisampayana.
quotes.image_prompt: Ghibli Art: The storyteller sits cross-legged, hands animated as he speaks. His audience of white-robed sages lean in intently. A subtle golden glow surrounds them as sacred smoke curls upward from a small fire between them.
quotes.context: Frame 4 of a 4-panel sequence. Focus: story beginning. Based on lines 0-40 of the Mahabharata. Sanskrit reference: जनमेजयस्य राजर्षेः सर्पसत्रे महात्मनः समीपे पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य सम्यक्पारिक्षितस्य च
